title: EU has 35 billion-euro list if U.S. hits its cars, trade chief says
text: The European Union will retaliate with extra duties on 35 billion euros ($39.1 billion) worth of U.S. goods if Washington imposes punitive tariffs on EU cars, the bloc's trade chief said on Tuesday.

title: Budget Deal, Earnings Strength From Lockheed, CocaCola, United Technologies Lift Spirits
text: One thing Wall Street arguably never wants is uncertainty about the U.S. government paying its bills and keeping the lights on in Washington.

title: "From the Government and Here to Help": Budget Deal in Washington Could Lift Spirits
text: An apparent budget deal in Washington is one more worry off of Wall Street’s mind, and could be helpful today for stocks. At the same time, earnings are mostly beating low expectations, so companies aren’t getting rewarded too much by investors.

title: BlackRock upgrades European assets in anticipation of a 'decisively dovish' ECB
text: BlackRock has closed its "underweight" position in European equities and credit, and upgraded European government bonds to "overweight," in anticipation of a "decisively dovish" shift in policy from the European Central Bank (ECB).

title: Dow's earnings reporters adding a net 25 points to index's price
text: The three Dow Jones Industrial Average components that reported second-quarter earnings Tuesday are adding about a net 25 points to the index's price, with two stocks gaining and one stock declining.

title: IMF lowers its global economic growth forecast again as risks remain to the 'downside'
text: The IMF trims its economic growth forecast again as the U.S.-China trade war continues, Brexit worries linger and inflation remains muted.

title: This FTSE 100 stock has sunk in July! Is this a terrific buying opportunity?
text: This British blue-chip bruiser hasn't had the best of it in recent days. Could it come roaring back, though?

title: These dividend stocks haven’t been scooped up by investors yet
text: Easy-money policies of global central banks have made dividend stocks more important than ever for investors who need income.

title: A big buying opportunity is unfolding in the market, Wall Street bull Tony Dwyer says
text: Canaccord Genuity's Tony Dwyer believes stocks are about to fall as much as 5% from their all-time highs.

title: Huawei first-half revenue up about 30% despite U.S. ban: Bloomberg
text: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's revenue grew roughly 30% in the first half after select teams secured critical supplies to keep production going despite U.S. technology export restrictions, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Oil slips to around $63 as Iran concerns fades for now
text: Oil slipped to around $63 a barrel on Tuesday as concerns faded for now that rising tensions in the Middle East would escalate and hit oil supplies, compounding the impact of a weaker demand outlook.

title: What If the Fed Does Cut Rates and It’s Already Totally Priced In?
text: June’s massive jobs numbers were amazing, and they showed just how strong the economy may be.

title: Hedge against FANG earnings with this ETF strategy
text: Exchange-traded fund experts offer strategies for playing tech giants' stocks ahead of this week's earnings reports for three FANG companies.

title: Big Tech Stocks Keep Rallying Among Danger Signs
text: Despite a rising tide of bad news, leading tech stocks are still enjoying heavy buying action from big investors.

title: As tech giants face Congressional investigation, states must step up regulatory oversight too
text: Tiffany Olson Kleemann Contributor Tiffany Olson Kleemann is the chief executive officer of Distil Networks. She formerly served in executive roles at Symantec and FireEye and was deputy chief of staff for cybersecurity operations under President George W.

title: Huawei lays off hundreds of US workers due to blacklisting
text: More than 600 Futurewei researchers lost their jobs.

title: Carmakers drive Europe higher, Johnson batters sterling
text: A wave of central bank easing and positive soundings from the earnings season buoyed world stocks on Tuesday, while Britain's pound fell before the expected confirmation of hard-Brexit advocate Boris Johnson as the country's prime minister.

title: Top investors lose $1 billion as China's Nasdaq-style board reverses on day two
text: The biggest shareholders in China's new Nasdaq-style STAR Market lost a combined $1 billion in the second day of trade on Tuesday, a day after the board's roaring debut created three new billionaires.

title: European stocks start higher, with banks gaining ground
text: European stocks sx:sxxp started higher on Tuesday, tracking gains in Asia after U.S.

title: Huawei head says group can sign 'no backdoor' deal with any country: Italy paper
text: Huawei Technologies, the Chinese technology and telecoms group under pressure from the United States, is ready to sign a "no backdoor" agreement with any country, its founder told an Italian newspaper on Tuesday.

title: Oil rises on Mideast tensions, glum demand outlook caps gains
text: Oil prices edged up on Tuesday on concerns about possible supply disruptions in the Middle East, but a weaker demand outlook kept a lid on gains, helped by a vow by the International Energy Agency (IEA) to keep global markets adequately supplied.

title: Randstad CEO attributes earnings miss to European auto slowdown
text: Dutch staffing giant Randstad on Tuesday reported underlying earnings slipping 4% in the second-quarter, slightly missing analyst forecasts due to a slowdown in Europe.

title: ECB, Fed rate cut hopes lift stocks, sterling sags
text: Expectations that the European Central Bank and Federal Reserve will cut interest rates boosted stocks globally, while the pound sagged on worries that likely new prime minister Boris Johnson would lead Britain into a no-deal exit from the European Union.

title: European markets seen higher as UK prepares to usher in new prime minister
text: Global stocks appeared to receive support from expectations that the ECB and the Federal Reserve could soon cut interest rates.

title: Shares on Shanghai's new tech board largely decline after strong debut a day earlier
text: Shares on China's new tech-focused board, the "Star Market," mostly saw steep declines on Tuesday morning following a strong public debut a day earlier.
